question: A system call is a way for a program to request a ________ from the operating system.
System calls act as a ________ between the user and the operating system.
The ________ system call is used to create a new process.
The exec() system call is used to ________ a new program.
The exit() system call is used to ________ a process.
The ________ system call makes a process wait for another to finish.
File management system calls help in ________ files.
The open() system call is used to ________ a file.
The read() system call is used to ________ data from a file.
The write() system call is used to ________ data to a file.
Device management system calls help in controlling ________ devices.
The ioctl() system call is used to ________ a device.
The getpid() system call is used to get the ________ of a process.
The alarm() system call is used to set a ________.
Communication system calls help programs exchange ________.
The send() system call is used to ________ messages.
The recv() system call is used to ________ messages.
The connect() system call is used to establish a ________.
System calls allow programs to interact with the ________.
Without system calls, it would be difficult for programs to perform ________ operations.
